text: That is the limit that employers have to pay you CPF until  aka if you earn 9k your employee CPF contribution will still be 1.6k (20% pegged to 8k)
What do the $6k and beyond numbers mean tho?

Currently the CPF ceiling is at $6k  meaning that employers only have to pay you up to 17% of $6k currently  and your employee contribution also capped at 20% of $6k. This $6k will be gradually increased to $8k by 1 Jan 2025. You do the math lol
ohhh so as of now  if I earn $20k  only 37% of $6k will be contributed to CPF?
but in 2025  37% of $8k will be contributed to my CPF if I earn $20k
okie  thanks for educating Kenji :)
